adventure_overview: There’s nothing like the great outdoors. In this Adventure, you will plan and participate in a campout with your Arrow of Light patrol or a Scouting America troop. You’ll learn how to pack, help plan using Scouting America’s SAFE Checklist, set up camp, and discover how Scouts camp. Prior to any activity, use Scouting America’s SAFE Checklist to ensure the safety of all those involved. All participants in official Scouting America activities should become familiar with the Guide to Safe Scouting and applicable program literature or manuals.

requirements.text: Learn about the Scout Basic Essentials.

activities.name: Scout Basic Essentials
activities.description: Cub Scouts learn the Scout Basic Essentials.

activities.name: Scout Basic Essentials Backpack
activities.description: Cub Scouts play a relay game to learn about the Scout Basic Essentials.

activities.name: Scout Troop Visitor
activities.description: Cub Scouts learn the Scout Basic Essentials from a member of a Scout Troop.

requirements.text: Determine what you will bring on an overnight campout — including a tent and sleeping bag/gear — and how you will carry your gear.

activities.name: IOLS Shakedown
activities.description: Cub Scouts have a camping gear shakedown with an IOLS (Introduction to Outdoor Leader Skills) trained leader.

activities.name: Troop Shakedown
activities.description: Cub Scouts attend a Scouting America troop meeting for a camping gear shakedown

requirements.text: Review the four points of Scouting America’s SAFE Checklist and how you will apply them. on the campout.

activities.name: Scouting America’s SAFE Checklist
activities.description: Cub Scouts apply the points of  Scouting America ‘s SAFE checklist to their campout.

requirements.text: Locate the campsite where you will be camping on a map.

activities.name: Digital Map
activities.description: Cub Scouts locate their campground using a digital device.

activities.name: Paper Map
activities.description: Cub Scouts locate their campsite on a paper map.

requirements.text: With your patrol or a Scouting America troop, participate in a campout.

activities.name: Den Campout
activities.description: Cub Scouts camp with their den.

activities.name: Troop Campout
activities.description: Cub Scouts camp with a Scouts BSA troop.

requirements.text: Upon arrival at the campout determine where to set up your campsite: kitchen, eating area, tents, and firepit.  Help the patrol set up the patrol gear before setting up your own tent.

activities.name: Campsite Setup
activities.description: Cub Scouts set up their campsite.

requirements.text: Explain how to keep food safe and the kitchen area sanitary at the campsite.  Demonstrate your knowledge during the campout.

activities.name: Safe Food Handling and Clean Up
activities.description: Cub Scouts learn about safe food handling and use the three-pot method for meal clean up method for cleaning

requirements.text: After your campout, discuss with your patrol what went well and what you would do differently next time.   Include how you followed the Outdoor Code and Leave No Trace Principles for Kids.

activities.name: Start, Stop, Continue
activities.description: Cub Scouts assess their campout using Start, Stop, Continue.
